title: About Me
text:
Collaborate on solving environmental issues using current statistical and analytical tools using the R language environment for statistical computing within the RStudio IDE.



Ph.D. in Wastewater engineering with thesis on the use of anaerobic membrane bioreactors for the treatment of municipal sludge Thesis. M.A.Sc in advanced wastewater treatment and applied management. B.A.Sc. in Civil Engineering. A professional engineer (P.Eng.) in the province of Ontario PEO. Currently pursuing accreditation as an Associate Statistician (A.Stat.) through the Canadian Statistical Society CSS.



Research in wastewater treatment (and sludge) for trace contaminants, microplastics and legacy pollutants. Worked on wastewater epidemiology investigating COVID in wastewater during the COVID pandemic. Developed design guidelines for wastewater treatment including extensive statistical analysis and assessment with reporting and publications. Actively engaged in supporting the regulatory role and oversight in Ontario related to municipal centralized and decentralized wastewater and sludge treatment.

title: Vince Pileggi
text: Vince Pileggi is wastewater engineer, adjunct professor, data scientist and uses advanced applied statistical analytical skills heavily in his work. He uses R, RStudio, Quarto and GitHub proficiently for advanced research and authorship of publications and reports. Vince enjoys early morning jogging.
